Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: Shank111
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with limited service. MTR(local train) station nearby. No indian food at all but decent other cuisine. Good local market outside. A McDonald and local restaurants are within walking distance. Room is small but aesthetic for solo use or light travellers . Good internet connectivity. Magic glass was surprize.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little far out”
Reviews.Author: Wilsonroom320
Reviews.Content: I stayed here having chosen it from the internet. I was very pleased with the hotel. The room was small but very comfortable (the bed was fantastic!), the Magic glass in the bathroom amused me, the view from my window was amazing and the staff were very friendly, pleasant and helpful. There are 7-11s, a supermarket and a Starbucks very close by if you don't want to breakfast in the hotel all the time. The absolute star of my trip was Mr. Francisco Beng Manuel, the Guest Services & Seccurity Manager. Nothing was too much trouble for him, whether it was taking me and showing me how to get to the local bank or managing the arrival of all my colleagues and their luggage on my last day there. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Business travels beware”
Reviews.Author: JMB337
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most business unfriendly places in HKG. No Wifi available in the rooms, and the only place you can access wifi is in their lounge, which conveniently doesn't open until 10:30AM!! No other business facilities available. Furthermore, after you pay $1700HK per night to stay there, they still require you to purchase the wifi in half hour blocks. The bandwidth on the wifi is so poor I struggled to get anything done. Hotel has a spa that was unattended during business hours the two times I attempted to use it. I never tried the food as I was too frustrated to want to direct any more revenue their way. At one point I counted 11 hotel employees in the lobby, 8 who were doing nothing. I would suggest to management they fire six employees and find a way to offer complimentary wifi in the rooms. Until then, no way do I come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josh S
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with very well presented, modern rooms. They're not huge, but then what do you expect in HK? Concierge were helpful, room service was prompt. The magic glass in the toilet amuses me. Simple joys. On the negative side, breakfast was fairly average, but then they are catering for a range of palettes. As usual in Asia, if you like congee you'll be in luck. Good value for what I paid - I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but hey its HongKong!”
Reviews.Author: Alexnjoo
Reviews.Content: Stay here for couple of nights. Small rooms but its ok considering its in Hong Kong. In front of Express shuttle from Airport express shuttle bus, so quite convenient. Location wise a bit far from main attractions and business district, but 2 blocks away from MTR station. Food also widely available

Reviews.Title: “Nice service ...”
Reviews.Author: Cdino
Reviews.Content: A nice space, with nice rooms and nice location ... The staff is 5*****

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: aimlesswander8888
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located--the bus from the airport stops literally across the street. A few minutes walk to the Tin Hau Subway Station, and Tin Hau Temple. Dozens of great restaurants just around the corner. Short walk to Victoria Park and the Causeway Bay shopping areas. Modern room, very clean and minimalist. A bit tight but I prefer that to large old room. Loved the Magic Glass in between the bed and bathroom, that can turn opaque or clear with a flick of a switch. Couples can have fun with it. Fantastic view from the lounge upstairs. Front desk quite helpful. Breakfast not as lavish as some hotels, but quite solid.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of things to be mindful of”
Reviews.Author: DRM77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Hotel in Causeway Bay for 2 nights at the end of June. On the positive side it is in a good location close to the action and also a short stroll to the enormous Victoria Park. The staff were also friendly. We did have two problems however: - We chose this hotel because it had a pool. This was a key factor in our selection of The Empire. However once we had checked in we were told the pool was closed for renovation. I understand these things happen, however it is still annoying - if you want a pool do check that any renovations are finished. - There is a construction site next door. Not a small one either. We were on the 20th floor and still awoke to the sound of half a dozen excavators with jack-hammers attached slowly demolishing the reinforced concrete of a building the size of a city block. Not the Empire's fault, again it's just one of those unlucky things for both their business and their customers. The hotel itself is OK however it is worth keeping these things in mind before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and local transport”
Reviews.Author: rocksteady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Empire Hotel for 3 nights. It is in a convenient location between Kings Road and Electric Road close to CWB Market. If arriving at Hongkong station on the Airport Express train, the free H2 Shuttle bus will take you to the Hotel. The Empire is located on the other side of Victoria Park away from the main CWB shopping district. The hotel has a small footprint but is 30 floors tall, so there are not many rooms on each floor. Front desk staff were very helpful in a crisis when our reservation was not found on arrival. They booked us in and sorted the problem out with our travel agent the next day. Our room was small, even by HK standards, with little space to hang clothes or store our cases. The bathroom was very small and divided from the bedroom by a glass partition. We did not choose this hotel for a wonderful harbour view, so were not disappointed that we could just about see the harbour through gaps between buildings. It is in a busy area with many bus routes running on all sides. A high floor gets you away from traffic noise. One thing that could be improved on is the lighting inside the 3 lifts. When the lift door closes the lighting inside is subdued to the extent of being inadequate. The hotel is surrounded by a mix of small shops, local restaurants and convenience stores. With Tin Hau MTR station just a few mins walk down Electric Road, plus frequent buses and trams on Kings Road, the Empire Hotel is a great place to start exploring HK. A compact modern hotel in convenient location with helpful staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edumacated
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Empire hotel for three nights during our New Year's eve trip in Hong Kong. The room was clean and had a nice bathroom with the magic glass. There was a problem with the shower door which wouldn't close properly and led to water leaking out to the bathroom floor. Another problem was the temperature controls in the bedroom, which didn't work. The room was cold all day and night. We notified the staff but they just gave us more blankets. Luckily we didn't get sick. I don't think I would stay here again during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Charlene T
Reviews.Content: Empire hotel in causeway bay is located just a few meters away from the subway station and there are restos convenience stores and bakeshops nearby. Check in time is 2pm we arrive earlier tho so we just left our things there and started roaming around. The hotel lobby as well as the room interiors are modern style and very cozy. Rooms are quite small but comfortable so its okay (hmm so-so). Rooms have a small ref inside, you get free coffee and tea (instant tho) and the rest have to be paid already. You will be welcomed by a huge lcd tv which changes its greetings dep on time. You can also use this lcd to communicate with the front desk personnel, order food and drinks, play games, watch tv, view subway map, and surf the internet (but you have to pay additional charge no free wifi). They used magic glass for the bathroom! Hotel staff are very kind and they speak english too! :) We traveled on April 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: Although The check-in time was 2pm we arrived off a 13 hour flight. The receptionist accomadated us and checked us in. Check-im took quite a while. The room was booked for three people but there was no extra bed. We had to pay 25euro a night for a rollaway bed that was as hard as a rock it wasliterally impossible to sleep on. Executive lounge was very cosy. The rooms arent very large but they are clean and comfortable. Our luggage got lost in transit but when it arrived at our hotel it was delivered straight away. There is a good choice of breakfast but not very western. Just had toast. The hotel is only 2minutes away fromthe metro station. Most of all that made our trip memorable was the concierge Tom. He was truly spectacular. Any time we needed a taxi he got us one, any time we needed directions he gave us them, any time we needed information he gave us it. He was the best concierge I have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round option in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable long-weekend at the Empire at Chinese New Year. We got two rooms, not inter-connecting but next to each other, which was fine for the family. Rooms were bright, nicely decorated and the kids liked the magic glass feature. Despite what some other reviewers say, I think the rooms are a decent size for a tourist hotel in HK. But the beds was a bit short for me - and I'm only 1.8m. Service was always friendly. Location is a big plus. Empire is the first stop on the free shuttle bus after you arrive on the Airport Express at Hong Kong Station. There are bus and tram stops nearby, and Tin Hau MTR station is just a few minutes walk from which you can easily access Causeway Bay. (If you prefer, and its not raising/too hot, it's an easy enough walk to Causeway Bay through Victoria Park.) There are lots of eateries close by, both Chinese and fast food. One thing struck me as a bit odd. On checking in, they wanted a HK$3000 deposit to cover additional charges for the two rooms, and as I didn't have cash they asked for a credit card. They actually debited $3000 there and then, rather than just getting the authorisation. They cancelled the transaction when we left and there was no problem, but I was checking my credit card statement every day until I was sure everything was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good service; rooms are a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: tahoch
Reviews.Content: Located about 3 blocks (6 mins walk) from Tin Hau MTR, this small modern hotel has really good service. Friendly folks all around and an excellent concierge service who can offer accurate directions to all the major attractions. They even offered to help get tickets to the theme parks for us after finding out our plans, etc. And for those who don’t speak Cantonese or Chinese, do not worry as they all speak good English. The staff are definitely a major asset to the hotel. There are also lots of restaurants, dessert shops, 7-11’s , fruit stalls & bakeries around the area so you won’t have any problems with food. Airport bus A11 stops at the main road about 5 mins walk up a slight slope, so you can actually have near door-to-door bus service to the airport without the expense of taking a cab or the inconvenience of changing buses for trains for the Airport Express. The rooms are pretty cramped so if you need the space or have kids bunking in, this may not prove to be your best choice. Also, try to avoid the rooms near the lift as the chambermaid service room is also there and it can get a bit noisy as they move in and out of that area.

Reviews.Title: “Unexciting but OK hotel "close" to Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: gdilieto
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel (couples traveling in March '12) is about an unexciting but good quality and conveniently located hotel, all in all a good fit for a vacation in Hong Kong. My "City View" room had enough space for a couple and the quality of the in-room amenities was good. Room came in a funny rectangular shape, long and narrow, a little strange at first sight but in the end space was enough. At the 8th floor, the view from our room was blocked by the buildings around and we did not have any "city view". All rooms face a quite busy street and we could hear the traffic noise since the early hours in the morning. For lovers of cool features, the bathroom has a "magic glass wall" that you can switch from glazed to translucent allowing to see through the glass into the bedroom. I guess this feature is supposed to allow city view across the room while showering, quite useless in our case per what said above. As noted in previous reviews, the hotel is not really in Causeway Bay but, past Victoria Park, in Tin Hau. I believe the area formally belongs to Causeway Bay therefore the indication is not formally misleading but, per what is common understanding, the hotel would be more properly said "close to" rather than "in" Causeway Bay. That did not bother us at all and as a matter of fact we enjoyed the location, in a lively neighbor with shops and eateries, just at a short walk through the park to Causeway Bay and with easy access to public transportation, whether subway, tram, bus or taxi. As mentioned, the neighbor is full of eateries, from local Cantonese to other Asian cuisines (plenty of Japanese) to western and we did not bother having any meals in the hotel. All in all, we were satisfied with the choice; the hotel is not exiting but the quality was ok, with the only negative worth mentioning being the street noise that at the 8th floor gave us wake up calls every morning. We also enjoyed the location. We would moderately feel recommending this hotel. Note that unless you get a high-floor, it is largely unlikely you will enjoy the view over the bay that is advertised on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “More like...Empire Hotel Tin Hau”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: Force of habit that I must try new hotels every time I visit HK. Themed with dark walls and dark lighting, the hotel looks gloomy. It's a boutique hotel with modern design, however rooms are too small. It's about 20sqm or less, but it was quiet. It's tagged as a Causeway Bay hotel, but It's closer to Tin Hau. Not too close to the station, about 10-15 min walk. The hotel is situated right in front of a Garbage refusal Point and a Pubic Toilet - VERY NICE VIEW! Their staff were accomodating, but almost all info you need to ask were already customized on their TV, so I'm guessing they don't want any more interaction.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: az412
Reviews.Content: booked empire hotel causeway bay thru MASholidays (together with flights). stayed for 4days 3 nights there. from the airport take the airport express to Hong Kong. at Hong Kong station take shuttle bus no H2 at the same level to empire causeway bay. the hotel is the first stop for this route (around 15min). first stop jz right in front of the hotel. cross the road and u'll be in the lobby. lobby is clean, quiet. check in was fast and efficient. got high floor room. however, 1st time in the lift a bit difficult as the lifts are dim. as if in a dark tunnel with a bit of lights. rooms are rather small (especially compared to similar type in KL). rooms are clean with all the amenities. the best things is for a small room, they have a big LCD tv - 42 inch. greetings are at the screen add a touch to the rooms. feels appreciated as a guess. another nice thing is the magic glass. it can be fun to work with! for me, this hotel is the at it's best location. not really at crowded causeway bay but at Tin Hau. roads are not cramped although streets are narrow. 5 minutes walk to tin hau station. what more can u ask for? :-)

Reviews.Title: “convenient location & very clean... but poor internet access”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in February and found the hotel to be of a good standard, very clean and very helpful staff. It is in a great location- a 2 minute walk to Tin Hau MTR station which has a quick connections to Causeway Bay and Central for the tourist areas. The hotel room was very nice with quirky magic glass in bathroom. The only downsides were that some rooms faced an area being developed and if you wanted a lie in- it was very noisy- also there is no wifi in the hotel unless you have access to the business lounge. I did as travelling for work- but it was expensive for a leisure traveller. You can access the internet via cable in room but this is chargeable. Didn't try breakfast as $99 dollars plus 10% service charge- within a few minutes are local bakeries, suermarkets and cafes plus a starbucks if you can't go without! You can walk to Times Square via Victoria Park which is a pleasant journey and if you ask at reception they can give you directions to the bus stop to Stanley on the other side of the island. Overall great- if you don't require internet access or if you like early mornings!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Causeway Bay!”
Reviews.Author: hany0u
Reviews.Content: Positive experience at the Empire Hotel - we actually stayed in two different rooms (one being alot better than the other in terms of cleanliness and having the smoke residue of smokers - even though it wasn't a smoking room). The rooms are small (but thats HK) but it was ok for a couple. Staff were helpful and the location was good as its right next to the MRT station - but if your going to walk to the town square (SOHO etc.) its about 20 minutes. Good foreign exchange rates at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Thaksin
Reviews.Content: For public transportation the Hotel si situated in an excellent location within 7 minutes walking time to Tin Hau MTR Station Exit A2 ( Direction sign in station will lead you through A1).It is 3 minutes away from the East 61 Wing HingTram Stop and across the road the West 38 Lau Li Tram Stop. I don't like the lights in the bathroom which is disturbing as most of the lights in the bathroom penetrate the glass partition into the bedroom. No free WIFI and it cost HKD 40 per hour or HKD 120 for 24 hours. The other problem is the dark lift and access is only through key card which is good for security. When I try to deposit valuables into the reception safe, the staff wanted to know my contents and whether it was possible ton remove it the next day . There is a safe in the room but I never trusted it. THer is no proper Lay By for buses to stop so it can be a bit risky loading and unloading luggages into waiting coaches.

Reviews.Title: “new year day gift”
Reviews.Author: sherpafamilyhk
Reviews.Content: we checked in the hotel on 1st jan 2012. even though we were early they kindly allowed us to have the room. the location of the hotel is very easy! the MTR and the victoria park are very close by and easy to locate. the room is really nice. the name on the tv to welcome you is a great touch! there is no iron or iron board but i guess you can ask for it. the bed is clean and comfortable as the rest of the room. the magic glass is great fun to play around with. the toilet ameneties are really nice. there is a coffee maker in the room also as well as a locker. two small bottles of free water. there is a road infront of the hotel so the lower floors will be a bit noisy. we were allowed to have the room till 2:00pm. this allowed us to go visit the tin hau temple very close to the hotel. we are very happy and suprised to find the hotel so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Small comfort conveniently located in Tin Hau”
Reviews.Author: yulyakub
Reviews.Content: We were staying there with a friend of mine for 3 nights, got a club room, so also got to use lounge on the upper floor with free internet there and drinks/snacks. This was nice considering internet in the hotel is paid, and, even in Starbucks, it is paid for everything over 20 mins, and, there is almost no free wi-fi spots around. Coming from Shanghai, where we are spoiled by lots of free wi-fi spots, it was something expected..so, do not expect it in HK :) Location of this hotel is, as already said in earlier reviews, is very good, really 7 mins walk to MTR. And, it is a first hotel to stop at for a shuttle bus from Airport (H2 line). It took around 1 hour 30 mins to get from the hotel to Central by the same shuttle bus H2, and than Central - Airport by train. Schedule says shuttle is every 20 mins, better give yourself some extra time. I was waiting 40 mins that time. This shuttle is really small, 15 ppl inside, no more. For a club double room, our was really tiny/small one, the space not covered by beds is so limited, it is hard to walk around. Bathroom - shower and toilet, and sink are also small. Yeah, they say space in HK is limited, but when you pay 2000HKD per night, something more of a comfort was expected. Went once for breakfast, which was on a very average side, poor selection of eatable western dishes. For the price, there are better places to go. Staff everyone was very attentive, lounge, lobby, reception - so, no complains.

Reviews.Title: “Too comfortable beds and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: Beds are really too comfortable to wake up in the morning :) They are like heaven beds. Location is very nice - it is like 7 min to Tin Hau station and about 15 min to Causeway bay station. We preferred to take everyday a walk to causeway bay station, because the road to it led through Victoria`s Park. Besides, 7/11 is just around the corner. Staff was very friendly, they will try to help you with everything. Can`t say anything about their breakfasts, because we didn`t take them. Rooms are tiny like all rooms in HK, but they are normal for two. Also they were clean. Magic bathroom wall is cool :)) Price is quite ok for its location, service and environment. p.s couldn`t choose the right time of visit - but it was august 2010, not 2011

Reviews.Title: “Fun location for a stay”
Reviews.Author: 15steps
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms in Hong Kong are notoriously small and cramped. However, I think the Empire Hotel does a good job utilizing a small space for most efficiency. The rooms kind of remind me of business hotels I have stayed in Tokyo. The name is also a bit misleading as yes, you are within walking distance of Causeway Bay but I think this neighborhood is actually Tin Hau which is the area on the other side of Victoria Park (lovely!) but having said that, I actually enjoyed staying in this area more (in the past, I have stayed at the Excelsior and in my backpacking days, also those family-run "hostels" in the heart of Causeway Bay). This neighborhood is filled with tiny local shops, restaurants and cafes. A two minute walk to King's Road is where you can catch the trams which run all along Hong Kong island. I preferred riding the tram to taking the metro, but do know that it's not a time saver as it literally took me about an hour to ride from my stop near the hotel to Central. But I had my camera and a great window seat, so I enjoyed every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel with cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: varunpathak1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and tall near causeway bay in Hong Kong. Staff is very friendly and speaks good English. The rooms are a bit too cramped in size. Beds were comfortable, TV having lots of functions from restaurant menu, current bill status, flight schedule etc. Hotel is just 2-3 mins walk from the Tin Hau MTR station which makes travelling in hong kong lot easier. Rooms have a magic glass between room and bathroom which becomes see through and blurry with push of a button (quiet funny actually). Did not try the restaurant in the hotel as i am a vegetarian and there were not many options. In room broadband was excellent, speed was fantastic. House keeping was very good. All in all comfortable hotel only size of the room is little too small.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel near underground”
Reviews.Author: themanfromdelmunde
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet (apart from the odd bit of building work nearby!) hotel close to underground. Room was small but fine for this budget in Hong Kong, and included a great big very comfortable bed. Didn't have any problem with the pillows as reported by a recent visitor! Magic glass in the bathroom is a fun little addition. Staff were courteous. Didn't eat there as it wasn't included on our deal so can't comment on the food. One of the free shuttle buses from the airport stops here, which is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Average Place”
Reviews.Author: Poneet
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel. The rooms are pretty small and not well laid out. Quite uncomfortable. However, the rooms are neat, the staff is courteous and very helpful. English language is a slight handicap, as chinese is more popular. Majority of travelers are from China and the south east asia here. Did not try out the food as it was mainly Oriental cuisine and almost totally non-vegetarian.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with clean room”
Reviews.Author: ERafanan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel Causeway Bay in late August 2011 with my hubby, the hotel is quiet and a little obscure for people to really notice it. Room was small but nevertheless its clean. Our window faces Wing Hing St. but there was not so much noise ( but we were on the 19th floor!) The closest MTR was Tin Hau station, not too far a walk away and there was a Welcome Supermart just nearby. As for food, there is a Mcdonald's and a Cafe de Coral nearby. The Tram has also a stop just near the hotel, I discovered that the airport bus also stops just across the hotel. We'll definitely be back sometime soon in the future, I like the location and proximity of food and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Work on the service!”
Reviews.Author: kryptful
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel early September, must say I am very impressed with the room they gave me, this was my first stay in the hotel, so not too sure if all rooms are equally big, or was it because mine was a corner room. You know how tiny hotel rooms generally are in Hong Kong? Even with the double bed, I could still literally do somersaults in the room! Then there was the in-built bathtub in the bathroom, which came with the magic shower glass (which fogs up eventually, whether you turn it on or not). The hotel is located three blocks away from Tin Hau MTR station, which is just one stop away from the ever-bustling Causeway Bay, easily accessible from the airport via the airport express, than the free shuttle H2, which stops right outside the hotel. Most of the time, I got around via the tram/ train: 1. If you are looking to go/ return from Causeway Bay (SOGO/ Times Square), do take the tram with the ShauKeiWan/ Happy Valley sign. Turn right upon exiting the hotel, walk straight all the way, and cross the road to get to the tram station. It gets you to/ back from Causeway Bay in no time, beats walking to the MTR station, taking the escalator and train waiting time in all. 2. Bus #10 across the street (also turn right upon exiting the hotel, walk straight and cross road) gets you to Admiralty and Central MTR station. Got a double bed, which was actually just two single beds put together, so half the time I was asleep, could feel the uncomfortable centre gap, oh and my toes were sticking out the bed (I am slightly over 1.7m). That said, you probably want to put in a request for a "longer" bed if you are over 1.75m. Also, there are convenient stores, a frozen yogurt store and decent eating places just around the corner, no more than a five-minute walk from the hotel, a plus point if you do not feel like venturing out. Got my three nights' stay at the hotel at a pretty reasonable rate, however, the hotel staff needs to work on its service attitude. Also, when I had made enquiries about the free shuttle to the aiport express station, they had assumed that I wanted to book the direct airport transfer (comes every hour, do check with the front desk the night before you are leaving), which cost about 150HKD if I remember correctly. It was okay they misunderstood, I gladly paid for the service since I needed to get to the airport anyhow, but I did not need to reach the airport till about 1430hrs, journey took about an hour and half, so I requested for a late checkout, say 1300hrs instead of the usual 1200hrs, but the hotel just rejected my request flatly. So, I had to lug my luggage to the lobby, sit around for about half an hour, and instead took the 1230hr airport transfer. (I figured getting to the airport earlier beats sitting around at the lobby for more than an hour.) The hotel did not seem packed with arriving tourists before I left, so could not understand why the staff did not allow a late checkout. Oh and WIFI is not free, pay to use, just like about everything else in the room. Geez.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great birthday stay!”
Reviews.Author: JayVG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from Sept. 4-6 to celebrate our birthdays. Here's how we decided on which hotel to choose: 1) Checked which hotels were included in the free shuttle service of the Airport Express 2) Checked which hotels were near the MTR 3) Checked which hotels fit our budget 4) Checked the rankings of the hotel shortlist on TA. And that's how we (happily) ended up with Empire hotel Causeway Bay. This was an all-walk-and-MTR type of trip and this hotel suited that purpose. After all, we wanted a bit of saving and a lot more exercise haha. We were the only riders on Airport Express bus H2 and in 10 mins. we were at the bus stop across the hotel. Loved the walk to the MTR and back. From exit A2 of the Tin Hau MTR, you're greeted by a milk tea place, noodle and congee shops and convenience stores. And a few MTR stops away, you had Causeway Bay and Mongkok. They gave us a cozy, corner room with a king bed on the 8th floor. After spending a full day of shopping, you just wanted to do the Nestea plunge on that comfy bed! And on the 2nd night of our stay, we came home to a surprise (as the pics reveal). Many thanks to Gloria Chung and EHCB staff for the very memorable stay. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: Prinszess
Reviews.Content: good hotel when you visit HK for business. Helpful and nice staff, specially in the business lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with average comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: AiKen0901
Reviews.Content: The room is quite small, good enough for one person. The room is clean and comfortable, and the hotel service is not bad. It is within walking distance to the Tin Hau MTR station. However, as it is the commercial/residential area, the shops are closed and it gets a little quiet and dark at night from the station to the hotel. There are eating places around the hotels in the day. There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the Central Airport station (the bus stop is just opposite the hotel). This can be convient during the peak timing when you can't get a cab. However, do note that the shuttle bus goes to quite a few hotels (about 30 to 45 mins ride)before it reaches the station. The hotel lobby and lift are quite dark, with dark-coloured tiles and dim lights. Overall, this hotel is not bad, comfortable and convenient enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kevin0870
Reviews.Content: Located just a short walk from the Tin Hau MTR station the hotel is quite conveniently located, 1 stop from the Causeway Bay shopping area and only a few stops from Central. There are many good restaurants and dessert shops in the neighborhood, on Electric Road and the side streets. The hotel rooms are a bit small (as are the bathrooms), but they are modern and well appointed. My only issue was that the carpet was a bit dirty. Overall, I would recommend the hotel to single travelers or couples who don't mind a tight squeeze, as the rooms are just so small.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Good Location!, Good service and food!”
Reviews.Author: Royalty1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic! When you first walk in you might wonder why the hotel has a smaller lobby but you'll see get use to this after a few days in Hong Kong all buildings seem to be built smaller from the ground the get larger as you get higher. Many people complain about small rooms but even though we were only two (Father and 15 year old son) they gave three beds and the room was quite spacious on the thirteenth floor. The buffet dinner was delicious and we only paid for one person because we were hotel guests. You'll also start to realize that nothing in Hong Kong is too far away and the hotel being in Causeway Bay really helped because the area Causeway bay is pretty much in the heart of it all. We loved it we'll defiantly be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: tanal
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Provide free shuttle from Hong Kong Airport to hotel. 2) Check in was smooth and Front Office staff was good. 3) MTR Tin Hau station is about 5mins walk (use the walkway through all the shops instead of the walkway at the roadside). 4) Most satisfied is the food in this area. This is the 3rd time I've been to HK, and this area have the best food of all! 5) Two 7-11 shops in this area. About 2mins walk to the 1st 7-11. Cons: 1) The rooms are small, as compared to other hotels in HK that i have stayed. Recommended for couple instead of families. 2) Lifts are dark 3) It is opposite the Garbage Collection, although no smells I would recommend this hotel for couples only. Pls note, it is not in Causeway Bay, it is in Tin Hau. (one stop from Causeway MTR Station)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Spyhotelier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, and we paid around HKD900 per night for their cityview room. The room is a bit small but their service makes us stay here again (quick check in and check out, very patient an helpful staff).

Reviews.Title: “Very small but very good”
Reviews.Author: vinniyang
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was so slick. We loved the design and the minemalistisc rooms. It's clean small and new. The staff os okay. Nothing special and there are not a lot of good tv channels. But it is in a really nice nabourhood in Causeway Bay right near the park.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good standard but poor service”
Reviews.Author: sp990
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times as this hotel for weekend and week trips. The rooms are bright, functional and comfortable with a nice working space and comfortable bed. The service can however be a bit poor from time to time. Staff are not polite nor helpful. The cheap rates generally compensate though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: trip12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on this end of HKG Island. Very modern. Quick and friendly check in. Because I booked on Expedia, internet was free. Clean room and a little tight. Nice big TV, desk, view, and bathroom although the"magic glass" was different. Two blocks from the metro and shuttle from hotel to airport express for free. Fairly expensive as hotels seemed to be on a Saturday night. Didn't look for restaurants nearby although a McDonalds a block between the subway and the hotel. Overall would return if the rates are right.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff, very cold hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocolato
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here at the recommendation of a friend. The location is great, the Tin Hau MTR station is close by, nice shop selling delicious Roast Goose, very famous dessert shop just around the corner, traditional dim sum restaurant where the locals have their early morning yum cha. The facilities around the hotel is fantastic, however I cannot say the same for the staff, they exude a very cold and unfriendly attitude. The hotel is not too busy, arrived at approximately 3pm in the afternoon and although I had reserved for a triple sharing room, was told by reception they have prepared a double room, after some checks, I was told they will arrange for an extra-bed. If it is not there, just call housekeeping for them to set it up. There was also some error in calculations, the gentleman who assisted me requested for a different amount, I explained to him and showed the confirmation letter. He then explained that Reservations had used the wrong code as such the incorrect rate was reflected on his screen. Eventually gave payment and deposit for the original amount which was quoted in my reservation. What happened next surprised me, a bellman was waiting for the same elevator, when the elevator arrived he just went in with his trolley full of luggage and left us to wait for the next one, only when I exclaimed they should allow their guests to enter the elevator, he asked us to come in, but it was full with him and the trolley, so we tried our best to make our way in. Over the next 2 days, the staff we encountered were either unfriendly or had their heads buried in paperwork. Overall a very disappointing experience. With so many hotels to choose from in Hong Kong, I think it is important to realise it is the people that make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny room and bad service”
Reviews.Author: KTMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed when we arrived in our room (stayed for 4 nights). The room is a lot smaller than advertised. The bathroom floor gets wet after each shower ( thought this only happens in south east asia) and the sink is so narrow that I couldn't move my arm (not a big person at all). The breakfast area stinks of blue cheese every morning and the toaster slot is too small for the bread plus it was broken when we were there. The staff was quite rude therefore breakfast was a quick affair for us every morning. Not a hotel we would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but its not in CWB ...”
Reviews.Author: Bee833
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a very good location, but don't be fool by the name because its not in Causeway Bay. To get to CWB (where all the shopping and restaurants are), you will need to take the MTR, taxi or tram but its still not far, only one MTR stop away! The closest MTR station to this hotel is Tin Hau. There are so many eateries near the Hotel. This is considered a "boutique" hotel, so don't expect the rooms to be very big. As a matter of fact, I thought the room was extremely small, a lot smaller than I had aniticipated. Overall, the hotel is average. The staff provided decent customer service but I wouldn't say WOW, if you know what I mean! Considering this hotel has only been open for year, it does not look brand new at all. My room was full of water marks on the wall and carpet and it did not look like it was a year old. My package came with a buffet breakfast, it wasn't bad considered it was included in my package. If you don't feel like eating at the restaurant, you can always go to any of the fast food places or restaurants nearby. There are lots to choose from. Most of cheap and cheerful too. Personally, I would not stay at this hotel again. I ended switching hotels during the last half of my visit to HK. I ended up staying at another hotel nearby which provided excellent service and a much bigger room with just a little bit more in price. We ended up staying at the L'Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and great location but extremly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: international_guy25
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and great location..its a 4min walk from Tin Hua station which is the next MTR to causeway bay. The street surrounding the hotel has great restaurants and juice bars also chemist so if you need any thing its easy to get. The rooms area really small..i mean really small ha ha but its HK so its expected unless you want to spend $500 USD a night. The bathroom is clean and new which is always important nothing worst then a moldy smelling hotel bathroom!. The internet is not free and its $120 HKD per day to use that's the only downside, i think internet should be free these days since its so cheap now. Didn't eat at the hotel since there's so many cheap eatery near by and central is just 10mins train ride away so didn't see the point in eating there. The check in staff was friendly enough and fast didn't have any issue. I can see why it be annoying if you had lots of luggage because of the limited space in the rooms and hall way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view from the 31st floor”
Reviews.Author: kenfrew
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room and it was very clean and comfortable. You could change the glass in the en-suite from frosty to clear! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was very good, a nice mix of Chinese and European. Only downside was the fact that it had no bar or lounge to sit in after a days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Words from the wise - Handle your own luggage”
Reviews.Author: The_Charmed_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I had left this same review on the comment card provided by the Empire Hotel ("Hotel"). Overall, the hotel is clean. Bed is quite comfortable. Room is extremely small, but that's just how it is in Asia. Bad replica of an European style bathroom. The space in front of the mirror and sink was so small that my husband couldn't lift his arms up for a clean shave. He walked out every morning with new cuts to his face. In my opinion, the shower shield was 1.5 inches short than it should have been. Had it been the right size, water would not leak out as much when we shower and we would not have flooded the bathroom floor every night. Location is a bit inconvenient as Hotel is on the Hong Kong side and most of everything you would want to do or sightsee is on the Kowloon side. We had to transfer at least 2 times each day to get to our sightseeing destination everyday. Servcies...... the big item. Upon arriving at the hotel (after 16 hours on the plane), bellhop broke my husband's aluminum Halliburton. Of course, my husband was pissed. The Hotel kept on telling us that it was an accident. Accident or not, it was their fault as we were inside the hotel room and the bellhop was in the hallway with the luggages when it happened. However, I was glad the Hotel remediated the issue. They took the luggage to an authorized dealer and had it fixed in time for our departure. By the end of our trip, I was happy with the outcome and was appreciative of the result and effort. Would I stay here again? Possible. I never say never. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny0306
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong recently for my honeymoon and the trip was quite good. As it was my first trip to Hong Kong, i look through many reviews through tripadvisor before making my bookings. My husband and I arrive at the hotel around 7.30pm. There were no porters greeting us at the door, nor there anyone assisting in our luggages. The check in was swift and we were given the key card to go to the rooms ourselves. I guess this is the way this hotel operates (with hostile feeling in the lobby) When we went into the room, the room was very small but clean. It is unlike the photos from the website at all. There is also problems with the TVs in the room and it seems like the sensor does not work properly and takes time to warm up before it takes the signal from the TV control. The bathroom is easily wet as there door to stop the water to flow through the toilet and the sink and we had to shower really carefully, otherwise the toilet will be flooded with water. And not to mention, the guest lifts are so dark, we had to squint our eyes and look really closely to the lift buttons before we can proceed to the floor. The hotel is not located exactly in Causeway Bay. the nearest MTR station is Tin Hau station which is 5 minutes walk away from the hotel and the trams stop right in front of the hotel's street, which is a plus point. Near by the hotel, there are plenty of restaurants, need not to worry about your late night hunger as there is McDonalds and a 24 hour Dim Sum shop nearby. Overall, the hotel stay is not too bad

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, cosy room, friendky staffs”
Reviews.Author: GreenOcean
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk to subway station. Lot of local and Asian restaurants nearby. Staffs are friendly in general. Room is cosy with smart use of space. The table is a bit small to put a computer on. It would be good if the internet is free

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place for Food- All types”
Reviews.Author: LynnGoh
Reviews.Content: I went there on 20-24 Dec and booked the hotel via Air Asia website. My husband said to book any hotels in causeway bay because of it's location. Hence this was the choice after read the reviews over tripadvisor.com. Not a bad choice if you have no problem for below dislike items. What I dislike most: 1) Bed. I can feel the round springs near the edges of the bed but they topped it up with nice, thick and comfy comforter. But still the bed was soft. I have backache problem as such I needed a harder bed but the bed in this hotel is not able to accommodate my needs. Bed was wide for a king size bed but it's a shorter version. I am 5ft4 and just the length of the bed. Got the idea? I also read about a long steel in the middle of the bed, we suspected it's 2 single bed joined together. 2) Pillow - to both of our opinions, it's the largest I have seen yet the softness I have ever slept on. It thins out when you slept on it. My husband and I have neck problem after one night sleep. What's the hotel solution? They added a harder smaller version pillows to support this. As the result, both of us slept on the smaller harder pillows. 3) Room size - not a good choice for big size Caucasian stay but only smaller and thinner size ones. Their rooms are almost similar size. My husband is 5ft 8 and yes his legs were sort of sticking out. 4) We stayed at room 2608, directly opposite the lifts and we could hear people talking while waiting for the lift early in the morning. Still tolerable. 5) Hongkong coffee, has a sour taste at the end of tastebud. It's heaty to my opinion. What I liked most: 1) Food - a very very convenient place. You can find locals, Viet, Thai and vegetarian food outlet. Yes, vegetarian. I happened to see at least 2 outlet but could be 3. I have the best time of tasting the local food plus buying some fruits. Their wanton mee is not the best. Should go for 'vermicelli wanton' or in Malaysia, we call it mihun wanton or bee hoon wanton. Their vermicelli was smooth and soft. Affordable. Bought apricots in box, sweet. A pharmacy, local electronic shops, so called dry sundry shops and many more. I bought fresh fruit juice near tin hau and along some of the fruit stalls. This stall has some English fruit juice menu which you can order. I can't read chinese but rely on the menu and the owner knows the fruits in English (haha). Try them out. They use original at least 4-5 fruits for a regular paper cup size and cost HKG12 per cup which happened to be the big cup. Very sweet and delicious. There are deserts small store, waffle stores, dim sum restaurant quite a few of them along the roads. 2) If you are into photography, there was a road that has many wet stores, catering seafood, vegetables and etc. 3) Tin Hau station was nearby, approximately 5 mins walk. You need to explore the place first thing you reach and recognise the surrounding outlet. There are about at least 4-5 road (not long ones) but very manageable. Opposite Tin Hau mrt area there is a Watson store. Tin Hau to causeway bay or kowloon, not very far. You must have the octopus card which save some cost and very convenient but if you have coins, you can buy one way journey cost about HKG4 everytime you travel. 4) Convenient to go to Ocean Park without the help of tour agent. From tin hau to admiralty station exit the place, search for the bus area, pay for the ticket which costs about HGK10.50 per way and Ocean park ticket HKG250 per person. 5) Hotel magic bath room - there is a switch for turn on and off, suitable for couples only ;P. It's a transparent bathroom! We have fun watching tv from the toilet (haha). The smallest basin area I have ever used but very modern looking. The room? Has also a very modern looking type. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's not in Causeway Bay but still good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katmky
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of this hotel wasn't too good - it's located opposite a rubbish collection station but luckily, no unpleasant smells or anything. As other reviewers have also mentioned, it is located about 5-10mins walk from Tin Hau MTR station (NOT Causeway Bay), which is not your usual tourist area but you will see where the locals live and eat in Hong Kong. I rather liked this location because it's away from the hustle of Causeway Bay but still within walking distance from it. There're great authentic eateries around the hotel which is a bonus! The first room we were given though, was not clean at all. The carpet didn't look like it had been vaccumed for a while. We requested a change of room and the second room we got was much better. The rooms are of course small - this is Hong Kong afterall. But we didn't go to HK to stay in our room all the time so this didn't matter. We noticed though, one lift was labelled "under maintenance" a lot of the time during the day. It was being used by the housekeeping staff so we had to wait for the lift for quite a long time. For a reasonably priced option in HK we would recommend this hotel, but the location and surroundings may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: carinb
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel at all. the staff are not helpful and most speak very bad English. for business traveller not suitable at all: a print out took more than 10 minutes. to arrange a town courier was not possible. the rooms are very small and have hardly any space to hang any clothes or to leave the suitcase. the house keeping is very bad and it can happen that you come back in the evening and the room is still not done. bills: please check them carefully, as mine was not correct either. breakfast is o.k. if you like chinese food for breakfast. most of the guests are mainland china tour groups who usually only stay 1 or 2 nights so the overall noise and hectic is very high when all are checking in and out in the small reception area. opposite the hotel is the recycling base: they start very early in the morning and are very noisy internet: if you use a Mac, ask for the Vodafone stick. the hotel intern system does not work with Macs. also note that this is extra charge of HK$ 100 per day. the nice view onto the skyline is only available in 3 rooms ....

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected; however, internet should be free”
Reviews.Author: Ganesh9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel Causeway Bay for 4 nights in November 2010. First of all, I am a business traveler and most of my daily activities take place along the Eastern Island corridor (from North Point to Shau Kei Wan). The location of this hotel is very good for me, but, technically, it is in Tin Hau, not in Causeway Bay proper. The lobby is small and there are three elevators but the waiting area is very cramped if one is trying to "queue up". The rooms are small but were clean. I asked for my room to be changed because I hate staying in rooms with a shared door. The staff was able to do this for me right away. A lot of people comment on the "magic glass" in the bathroom and it's fun to play with for 30 seconds but after that it becomes tiring. The hotel has wall mounted LCD TVs but these took a lot of time to "power up" and minutes would go by before I could select the TV instead of staring at the navigation menu for the hotel. There is an internet connection but you have to pay for it (HK$120 per day). It should be free. I did not try the breakfast buffet so I cannot comment on it. The price paid for this hotel was very reasonable considering some of the dumps that many unsuspecting travelers end up in. While the hotel *is* across the street from a waste collection site, no smells or noise every bothered me. I like the Tin Hau neighborhood a lot. It is a real neighborhood where people go about their everyday business and is not dotted with touristy shops and big hotels. There is a hotel shuttle bus that goes to the airport but for a fraction of that price you can catch the A11 bus across the street on King's Rd. I usually stay at the MetroPark Causeway Bay but it seems their prices have gone up considerably. The next time I am in HK I will seriously consider the Empire again.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Options that the Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: I was at the Empire Hotel, Causeway Bay for 5 nights on business with my husband. It's new (which is always a bonus) and reasonably convenient, but compared to other options at the same price, I would definitely not stay here again! This hotel looks trendy on the surface but it's all effect and not practical. Here is a list of all the things that bugged us and I would suspect be an issue for many others as well. You should know the hotel is across the road from the Tin Hau Public Toilet and Refuse Centre - so not a charming street or location in HK (but it is 5 mins walk from MTR train). Lift and lift lobbies are a nightmare - unbelievably slow lifts and a tight and ridiculous lift lobby to wait in -- amongst the thousands that seem to check in and out all the time. Apparently this is a popular hotel for mainland China tour groups - enough said? Buffet breakfast is pretty basic - I wouldn't bother to be honest. Rooms are small and OK in terms of look - but you have to turn on your side to walk from 1 side of the room to the other as only about 30 cms from the end of the bed and the wall! Bathrooms are modern but very tight. Internet, as usual costs a bomb and there's no wireless - bizarre for a modern hotel. It's not where you should stay if on business. I'd prefer to stay in the Metropark Causeway Bay as everything is infinitely better than Empire Hotel - and usually at the same price. Unfortunately Metropark was booked out during the time we were there. Empire Hotel is also not in the best location to get a cab -- but there are some small and good Thai restaurants nearby which is where you should eat - not at the hotel. Wouldn't bother with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small bed and tight bathroom”
Reviews.Author: marie_ms2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at many small/boutique hotels in the past and must admit that the Empire Causeway Bay is a very poorly designed one. I am only 5'7" or 1.7m and my feet stuck out of the bed by 3". The bathroom is extremely tight. It is easier to undress first, lay your things on bed, then get into the glass shower. The lobby's elevator bank is too high concept in design...extremely tight gangway for a high traffic area with guests and luggages in exchange for a spacious outdoor pebble field outside. Overall absurd design/architectural concepts. The price is good and it is a fairly new property. So if you're short and traveling with your spouse, then go for this!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with a big heart”
Reviews.Author: Icebergs2
Reviews.Content: We went to HK to attend a wedding last year and this hotel was highly recommended by friends in the travel industry. We finally settled for it after some elaborate research and deliberations we are extremely glad we did. We arrived at the hotel late Saturday night and were cordially greeted by several staff who later offered us an umbrella when we went out for a bite to eat in the midst of a drizzle. Check-in took a little longer than expected and the staff had the good sense of putting our Louis Vuitton luggage behind the front desk just in case they might walk away. Our room was quite small and the twin beds were too short even for a medium height fella like myself. Be extra cautious when taking a shower as I found the bathroom floor very slippery and the tight space didn't help either. We had to go to Macau the following day and the staff had agreed to lock up some of our luggage till our return and likewise promised to upgrade our room since we would be there for another week. The new room was larger with minimalistic decor and there was a small work area with a swivel chair in front of a window that allowed me a good view of the market on Electric Road and even a glimpse of the Victoria Harbor. The service and attitude of the staff continued to be great and I really enjoyed our chit chats. I also have a serious back problem which can affect my mobility and during our stay, I had returned to the hotel on two occasions and the staff responded right away with a wheelchair, brought me up to my room and even offered to put me to bed if needed. The food at the hotel was mediocre but there were lots of eateries in the immediate vacinity which served anything from Waygu beef, foie gras and blue fin tuna to soul food like wonton noodle soup, congee, dim sum etc. And if you like robata, sashimi and sake, a few Japanese restuarants have recently opened up just a few steps from the hotel. No need to worry about drunk driving.

Reviews.Title: “Good (but small) Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: delilah86
Reviews.Content: Room was nice but small - perhaps typical for Hong Kong. However the space that we did have was very nicely kitted out and used to the maximum extent. Nice flatscreen TV and amazon shower. Staff were helpful and efficient in general. We ate in the hotel by room service and also in the restaurant on a couple of ocassions. The western style food is perfectly edible but not fantastic - still a good fallback when you need a burger! Location was good, very near Tin Hua station which is only one or two stops from the city centre on Hong Kong island. The area felt safe yet authentic. The spa was ok, I had a Chinese acupressure massage which was interesting and very unlike massages in Europe - I'm not sure I'd recommend this aspect of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience hotel”
Reviews.Author: kongsp69
Reviews.Content: We searched for many hotels in Hong Kong to find not only the reasonable price but also convenient location. Empire Hotel Causeway Bay answered all my questions. We can travel around Hong Kong easily by MTR and the hotel is very close to Tin Hua station. Room has cozy and comfy atmosphere with white and gray theme. Moreover, a lot of restaurants are all around the hotel from morning dim sum to evening wonton noodle. Also hotel's staff is nice and helpful. But housekeeping here needs to be improved. The only one not-so-good thing we found is hair in the bathroom. We saw hairs since we checked in until our last day. Anyway, overall is acceptable. Staying here is exceeded our expectation in everyway. Will be back to Hong Kong and stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: WelshladyItaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for 2 nights. On our early morning arrival there were 5 people behind the reception desk and not one said good morning. We were told our room wasn't ready but there was a smaller one available. We were tempted because we were very tired after travelling from Italy so we asked if we could see it before accepting. This request was refused so we decided to wait till ours was ready which miraculously was given to us after 10 minutes or so! Apart from this bad start I have to say that we had a pleasant stay. The room was comfortable and we could even see the sea between the tower blocks. The location is brilliant, 5 mins from the underground. It is also close to Victoria Park where my husband joined in with a group doing early morning Tai Chi. Breakfast is adequate. It was so funny because there is background music and we had our breakfast listening to Slade's "Merry Christmas Everyone" (it was 18th August!!!). It is hard to think that this is a newish hotel as it is already a bit rough around the edges, but if the price is right then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: belibulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights before my another business dealings in Shanghai. Didn't think it was that worse as the others reviewed. I mean for a price like this, I got more than I expected. Location - nice! Just a few mins walk to Tin Hau MTR station (subway), and one stop only to Causeway Bay. I'd rather staying here than in Causeway Bay, it's just too crowded and feel like I'm just sleeping next to the main road. Some reviewed there's a refuse stop next to the hotel, I don't see it's a problem for me as it's not smelly after all. Room - room size is not huge of course, but acceptable, like the modern chic design, simple and minimal. The bed is nice and I sleep really well during my stay. Overall, it's clean and tidy. Service - both check-in check-out are swift, even housekeeping lady responded quick when I requested extra bottle of water. Nearby - lots of cafes and restaurants nearby, western, japanese, indian and chinese, thus I didn't try their own cafe except for a light breakfast every morning. Choices are ok, all I want is just bread and coffee. So this part is just fine with me. Overall, no complain for a charge like this. Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good location, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: kw32
Reviews.Content: Some irks with service -- they kept telling us we hadn't pre-paid breakfast so it was a rigmarole each morning (jet-lagged) to prove that we had before they'd give us a cup of tea... Otherwise though this was a decent place, good location, good clean rooms, good breakfast once you got it, and appreciated the surprise of a welcome tray delivered to the room on our third night!? Worth booking ahead online to get discounted rates on the rooms here. Don't be put off by the fact that the 'city view' rooms have a view of a municipal refuse centre, they're really fine.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably clean - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: kohivy_kiv
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff's service is great - I would have given this hotel a higher rating if not for the issues with the bathroom. Great service When I had problems with internet access, I had to call Reception several times and they were able to give me the information needed or send the IT person to my room within 10 minutes to attend to my internet access problems. Same for housekeeping requests such as floor mat and iron. That's pretty quick in my opinion. The only reason why I may return to this hotel is their great and prompt service. Bathroom This is the reason why I needed floor mats. The design of the bathroom is faulty. There is no door (glass or otherwise) that separates the shower cubicle from the toilet area, and the bathroom floor is almost level with the floor in the toilet area. Does that raise any alarm in you? What it means is that a lot of water from the shower cubicle will flood the rest of the bathroom, making the floor wet after your shower and gives one a generally icky feeling. I requested for fabric floor mats so that they can absorb the water. There was less of a flood but it didn't entirely eliminate the flooding problem. When I described the flooding problem to the staff, they said they were aware of this but could only attribute it to the bathroom design. The next gripe I have involves the tap/washbasin in the bathroom. The metallic rectangular tap juts out centrally into the washbasin, which makes it difficult for me to bend down to wash my face, because the tap would hit my face. Thought this was a rather awkward design/location for the tap! Location was ok, with 24 hours MacDonalds and several restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but nothing fantastic. The MTR stop Tin Hau is within a few minutes' walk, but I was rather daunted by the last flight of stairs from the underground station to ground level, as I was lugging a rather big piece of luggage and had to carry it up the last flight of stairs (no escalator!) Well, for me, I wouldn't be in a hurry to return to this hotel, unless I cannot find a better one. The next time I go to Hong Kong, I would definitely want to try other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good price with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Prof_AD
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here and completely booked by accident. I thought I was booking Empire Wan Chai. I was very pleasantly surprised to find a modern new hotel so close to Causeway Bay. The rooms were small but nice with a fantastic bathroom. The hotel has few facilities and those looking for all the trimmings (pool, restaurants etc) would be advised to look elsewhere. The location is OK. Causeway Bay is just across Victoria Park and its pretty easy to get a taxi (even during peak hour) and the MTR station is within walking distance. The local restaurants are OK with a decent variety around the hotel. The staff were generally helpful. Although a few seemd a little lost as their knowledge of Hong Kong Island suggested they are primarily from the New Territories or Kowloon as they didn't know where many things were on HK island. All in all a good experience. I would definiotely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the newly established hotel”
Reviews.Author: antoniophilippines
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean and good in service, though small with HK$800, it is already with breakfast buffet for two every morning. just the location is a bit far from shopping malls like Causeway Bay and North Park, you've to walk and ride teng2 to get to malls and supermarts, the stores closes early within the area . yet thanks they gave us VIP card for a 10%discount on next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: kevintrimble
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 4 nights, and were definitely pleased with the hotel. It's a typical budget hotel, and got all the things right that it needed to. The rooms, while small, are clean and the staff takes good care of them. The location is not in the best location, but is within a 5 minute walk of Tin Hau station, which is a 60 cent train ride away from the more popular parts of town. It's also a 5 minute walk from the very nice Victoria Park, which is a good place for a stroll or an outdoor workout if you're interested. All in all, for what we paid, I was very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: Terrible location - the hotel is right outside a refuse collection centre. Breakfast - don't even bother - go out to the local bakery. Rooms are pretty good size for HK. Lobby is freezing cold - as is the club room on the 30th Floor. Room was filthy - the bathroom was covered in hair - and try not to pick up the rubber bath mats - you probably don't want to find out what is under there. Carpet in the room was not vacuumed on arrival or during my stay. If your a business traveller as am i - there is little room to hang suits/shirts etc if you are staying more than a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: DorCologne
Reviews.Content: Our room was very very tiny (not sure about it, but I guess it is normal for Hong Kong). Everything was clean and in good condition. Breakfast buffet has got great choices. The hotel is close to the tram and MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and an authentic inner city neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: TurfTycoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Causeway Bay with 5 friends (one room each!) as part of a trip to see the Hong Kong International races. Quite enjoyed being away from the city centre (though easily accessible by public transport) as there were no glitzy shops or fast-food chain stores and tourist traps. Although the Hotel calls itself Causeway Bay it is close to Tin Hau MTR (tube) station and the surrounding streets have quite a few small restaurants and also small grocery stores, butcher etc - it feels like an authentic inner city neighbourhood. The hotel itself was newly renovated (according to our HK-based friend) and for a bargain price (HK$550) I was more than happy with the room, which was small, but not as small as I feared it might be. Everything was clean and modern - my only criticism of the housekeeping service was that it was somewhat unpredictable - you never knew when (or if!) they were likely to arrive - but it all worked out ok. The restaurant downstairs served up an acceptable breakfast spread - I didn't eat there for dinner as we had some athletes from the Asian Games staying at the hotel and they monopolised the dining room several evenings. Front desk staff were fine and the Concierge was really good - as friendly and helpful as you expect someone in that role to be. The public transport system in Hong Kong is excellent. Very clean and a very efficient and cheap service - get yourself an Octopus card if you are staying more than a day or two. It's not much of a chore to get the tube into town and vice-versa and you can also walk to the top of the street and take the quaint tram from one end of the island to the other. I crammed into a tram to go to the Happy Valley races - it was sardine-city but all part of the fun - the tram is also a great way to take in the night sights. I felt safe around this area, even when returning home fairly late at night. It is reasonably well lit and all you generally saw were locals going about their business, walking their dogs or chatting outside a noodle bar. I took the plunge one night on my own and ventured into one of the small basic cafes that only seemed to be frequented by locals. No-one spoke any English and I shared a small table with strangers. The food was nice and everyone was relaxed and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan88
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location - very near the MRT - Tin Hau station, which is only 1 stop after Causeway Bay and it is only a few minutes walk. (Note: To take exit A-turn left- when exiting the station, the sign says Exit B which is not right and is a longer way) Situated near Victoria Park and plenty of dessert shops nearby. The rooms are clean and furnished modernly. Cons: The rooms are not spacious, but that's Hong Kong for you, you get a taste of living in a shoe box, literally. :) Our single bed sizes was really small, for those bigger in size would find them uncomfortable. The toilet has a frosted glass which you can switch on or off to make things romantic or kinky. Suitable to stay with your close friend or your spouse/lover. Don't think it is suitable for work/colleagues. There is no swimming pool and internet is not free. They should have free wifi to stay competitive with other hotels. Overall, we had a pleasant 3 nights stay here. The staff were friendly, helpful and polite. Most taxi drivers we encountered knew where it was - mention Wing Hing Kai, near Tin Hau MRT station. We prefer this hotel compared to their other branches in Wan Chai as this is more peaceful with less traffic and noise pollution. Enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this hotel for those who want to stay in Hong Kong Island with some privacy and away from the commercialized and crowded areas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room - perfect mid-price hotel”
Reviews.Author: webzen
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for me! Everything about the room leaves me satisfied. The room in square meter may be small to medium, but feels very roomy and comfortable.. Feels big due to the design which is Japanese business class with a very modern flare. The wall and floor are marble, the carpet has an interesting design(not generic beige). The bathroom are enclosed in glass.. as well as the small desk in glass and wonderfully supportive office chair.. The TV hangs on the wall and the bed is very nice with nice white sheets. Then there is the overhead shower that feels like a waterfall so much like some of the hot spring in Japan. Taking a shower is a pleasure in this hotel. What else? There is a small refrigerator, a safe, two bath robes, lots of hanger space, things to clean your shoes etc..... All my needs are met. The hotel staff is excellent. They bring my luggage from the Airport shuttle into the hotel hold it for a few days without charge while I visited China. Open the door for me pleasantly. I felt welcomed by the staff. The hotel is in a neighborhood, you get a feel for the citizen of hong kong. Within a block you can hop on a tram that may be 80 years old and go all the way to Times square and Central for a mere HK2.00. I had a wonderful time for 5 days using this hotel as a base. I will COME back again and again. The TV also serves as a tool for you stay...very useful like weather etc. The air conditioner is so quiet I keep it on through the night as most people do in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: blueblend
Reviews.Content: Small room is understandable because there is Hong Kong. but, low service quality can't suppressed, specially front desk staff's attitude. When i stayed in the hotel, air is very cold (i think heating system didn't work properly), so i asked the front desk staff to check the system to warm the room. However the reply by the staff is "This hotel DO NOT provide any heating system, so giving additional blanket is just ALL THAT HE CAN DO", if i was bothering him. I've ever stayed many hotels over many countries, i'have never heard of hotels heating system is not provided. If room's temparature is the same as outdoor, this is A TENT not a hotel. And the hotel staff is the most rude, impolite, so i thought if i was a manager of that hotel, i NEVER hire him as an employee of the hotel service industry. Anyway he made Hong Kong is the worst place to travely and i decided to NEVER come here and the hotel INDEED.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, small rooms but nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGreg
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel is located a few minutes walk from Tin Hau MTR stop which we found to be very convenient. The hotel has a modern feel to it & our room was very tasteful. We didn't have much luggage with us, just a couple of bags, so the tiny room size was bearable, however if you are travelling with large suitcases you might want to look at the room size before booking here. The bathroom was compact & I did manage to bash my foot on the door whilst trying to open it, but the shower was a good size & this was all ok for the one night's stay that we had here. Breakfast was pretty average, I have stayed in Hong Kong many times & very rarely come across a hotel that has a breakfast that I fully enjoy as I like western style & of course this is Asia. I'm sure that the Asian options are very good so if you enjoy congee etc for breakfast or are more adventurous than me then I'm sure that this will be to your liking. If not the toast & pastries are fine & get you started for the day. The staff were very polite & helpful, check in & out was hassle free. There were also no musty smells or any other unpleasant odours in the hotel which was a major plus! The only negative was that the lobby was very dark & had limited seating, we found there to always be people hanging around so it did get quite busy in there sometimes. However this is not something to sway your decision as to whether to stay here or not! We paid around £70 for the room which I think is around the price that it is worth, so if you find a good deal for The Empire Hotel I would recommend giving it a go!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper1on1
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights last week. Clean hotel and clean rooms. Very comfortable bed and trendy decor. Good prompt housekeeping. Great price 550 HKD. Complimentary breakfast quite good. Polite service. Standard shoebox size Hong Kong hotel rooms. Excellent location with MTR, tram and bus stop within walking distance. Great local eateries and fresh fruit stalls within 2 minutes walking distance. Don't understand the other reviewer's complaints - my A/C thermostat worked fine, housekeeping prompt, nothing wrong with the shower and water doesnt splash out if the shower door is shut. Most HK hotels have the same view - smoggy skies and old buildings jostling for space.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Great Location, Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: Rach3L_120
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was close to the "Tin Hau" MTR station. About a 5 to 8 minute walk so quite convenient for getting around. There are local eateries around. The hotel is new, so the rooms are clean and modern. View from the hotel room wasn't great at all. You look out and see old buildings that are adjacent. The hotel room is small, but I guess that is standard to Hong Kong's hotels. The bathroom looks nice and elegant but the shower area is a poor design as there is no closing shower door. After you take a shower, it's a bit of a mess as half the bathroom floor is wet because there isn't an adequate way to keep shower water from spilling out. I was very satisfied with my stay because I got a great deal on the hotel price on the agoda website. I paid around $800 HKD, and you really can't get a better hotel than this one with that price. I would say the location and price are the best features of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I like the location”
Reviews.Author: civicguy
Reviews.Content: Love the location. As it is near good eating places and i enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the local area. Find that it is close enough to trams, MTR, buses. I like the fact that it has a good TV system which allows me to even watch HD ! See this link: http://tinyurl.com/ygxlg4n

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping service and room designs”
Reviews.Author: ChocoholicMax
Reviews.Content: HOUSEKEEPING * Housekeeping was extremely poor. We switched on the "Do Not Disturb" light and housekeeping ladies continuously pressed the door bell, knocked on the door and even charged into our room whilst we were still sleeping. This was about 7am - 10am which is considered early in Hong Kong given that shops don't open till about Noon and the nightlife. Housekeeping ladies disturbed twice in the morning - once for laundry and once for room service - was this necessary?? * We informed the housekeeping lady to come back at a certain time, but this clearly was not taken note of as they came back way before the time advised. * The number of towels in the bathroom were not fully replaced despite them all being collected for laundry. The soap dispenser was not refilled - we had watery liquid squirting out of the dispenser instead of gel-like soap which meant they previously filled the dispenser with water instead of soap?? Cost cutting?? * Our friends in other rooms were given complimentary bottled water and their fridges had drinks and room had a variety of snacks available - we had none of the above!! * Complimentary toiletries were never replaced. Also, my slippers left in the bathroom were thrown away and were never replaced during my week's stay at the hotel.
