ROOM * Rooms were modern but designed poorly - the bathroom floors were slippery and my friend slipped and was hurt. * For those who want more privacy whilst in the bathroom, the bathroom design of the hotel does not offer this. * Only good thing was that rooms were clean, modern and presentable especially with the 42 inch LCD TV. Overall, despite the convenient location and good value for money, I would not recommend this hotel to a friend due to the negative feedback above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, no-frills, forget about Internet access”
Reviews.Author: Wspider
Reviews.Content: Travellers: Two ladies; one for business and leisure, the other for leisure <Good> - Fantastic location, especially if you're going on a gourmet trip. Breakfast options are aplenty (so please don't spend excessively on the forgettable breakfast at the hotel's cafe). Breakfast options include the Cheung Lee Restaurant round the corner. For HKD 20 you get a hot breakfast plus a drink. Or go for the well-known club sandwich. For the local buns and homemade hot soy milk, take two left turns from the hotel. If you're into congee, there are more than 3 options within a 3-min walk. Lunch and dinner options are aplenty too. Roasted meat and rice, fantastic and well-known beef noodle stalls. There's also Japanese, Thai and Vietnamese restaurants. Have a sweet tooth? My pal and I went on a binge almost every night at the many dessert shops near the hotel. For local dessert options, try Ching Ching (green signboard). Cakes and such, try Yu-E (facing the hotel) or The BubbleFactory which has FREE internet access! Bring your laptop. - No clubs but hey, the MTR is a stone's throw away. Imagine walking back tipsy and you need to clear your head? Go to the dessert shop for hot sweet soup and clear your state of mind. Open till midnight. - Location again, people are generally friendlier here as this is considered a suburban area. We felt like we were waking up to a nice gentle pace and headed for the hectic in Wanchai, Central or Causeway only when we were ready. - Taxi ride to Hong Kong Station (for the Airport express) is usually approx. HKD 38. To get to the hotel, take the MTR to Tin Hau, exit from A2 and keep going straight for about 4 - 5 mins (with consideration given to the luggage in tow) past the many local food shops. My pal and I took the tram upon arrival (Yes, with our luggage). Pretty convenient but a bit of a walk from HK station to Central station, about 10 mins. Get to the ground level facing the roads and look for the tram stop facing Citibank. Take the one going East. Took about 30 mins to reach the hotel. More fun and saved some cash - nice experience. - Plenty of laundrettes, and they work fast and clean. - Took a cab to the office in Wanchai. Taxi fare came to a low HKD21, in 8 mins. <Bad> - First room on 22nd flr given smelled bad. I have sinusitis so we were sent to a room on the 26th flr. The latter was a smoking room, literally, as the smoke lingered in the air from the previous group of guests. Finally we were given a non-smoking room on the 30th floor - with a harbour view! That smelt... ok. The weather was at the tail end of winter so there was no way we could accept a room with a dirty filter. - There are 3 lifts. At times, one of the lifts would be under maintenance, but let's cut the hotel some slack. - Facing the local dump, but Surprise Surprise, the local municipality ensured that there was no foul smell emitted from the dump. They even took pains to cover the unsightly entrance with a humoungous and beautifully designed poster. It was no issue at all. - Did not like the shower / toilet area. Both shared the same door, which means if you shower, there's a high chance you wet the floor area of the toilet as well. You end up having to dry the toilet area after each shower. My pal felt it was ok, though. - I like hard beds, but my pal felt that the soft beds were great. - Forget about Internet access at the hotel. Only 2 choices 40HKD for one hour, 120HKD for 24 hours. Go to The BubbleFactory for FREE internet access, bring your laptop. Just be nice to the folks there, and buy something from them. - Housekeeping needs to improve and be consistent. But no major problems. Just ensure you have enough tissues and toilet paper in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great view, good service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldz72
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The price was reasonable (I think around HK$800 per night. It was a quiet street (if that's possible). the room was small but well-designed and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: x_5tuu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5N in late October, and booked this hotel blind and on a whim, as there where hardly any reviews or pics of it since its conversion into a hotel. No deterred by this we found the hotel no problem (granted its not technically in Causeway bay - but its damn close). The room was small as with pretty much all HK hotels, but checkin was swift and the room was immaculate, and nippingly clean, with decent views and floor to ceiling windows. Magic glass walled bathroom was fine, and private with no problems at all. The location was fantastic, more of a real experience of HK, we previously had a bad experience of HK staying just off Nathan Rd, with all the touts and WHY. Lots of small restaurants and stalls on your doorstep to tempt, very friendly locals and easy walking distance into causeway bay (30mins stroll maybe). Room service was fantastic and not expensive. HK Island is much nicer to stay on than Kowloon, less hectic and more pleasant to discover - staying at this hotel has swayed me and my better half massively on HK and would now come back in a heart beat and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but neat and clean”
Reviews.Author: Maveli
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 days.we were their only for nights , never used bfast or anything. but i need to say room and bathroom is very well maintained, there was LCD with few local channels n few ozi channels. it is near to tin hau metro station and very well connected to other parts. i would like to visit again ...

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Nice Hotels in HK”
Reviews.Author: BrezzyMalaysia
Reviews.Content: I like thier toilet very much, it is the glass but you can turn the switch to make it blur to aviod your friend to see in. another one thing is LCD TV is very big but the room is quite (i know spaces in HK is very expensive) I can see the building of city from my room. One of modern and best hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money !”
Reviews.Author: holidaysmaker
Reviews.Content: After returning from Star Aquarius cruise , we stayed 1 night in this hotel. It was a good hotel, nice clean rooms & good service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely modern hotel, representing excellent value for money - in good location”
Reviews.Author: glencdawson
Reviews.Content: To summarise, the Empire Hotel in Causeway Bay is an excellent 4 star hotel, offering extremely modern, comfortable rooms and is great value for money. It is conveniently located just outside the Causeway Bay shopping district and within a few minutes’ walk of the MTR (Tin Hau station). Plus points:- The hotel is almost brand new (as of November ’09). Therefore everywhere from the lobby area to the actual rooms is in pristine condition. The rooms are extremely modern and are decorated in a very contemporary style. The bathroom had a ‘magic glass’ button, meaning that you can sit in the bath and un-obscure the glass. This results in you being able to see through the bathroom wall and out of the exterior window. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are equipped with everything that you need including mini bar, safe, gowns etc. The air conditioning worked very well as did the shower. Being less than 5minutes walk away from Tin Hau station means that it is feasible to get from the airport to the hotel, without having to take a taxi It is possible to walk back from a night out in Causeway Bay, after the MTR has closed, in around 15 – 20 minutes. Although I didn’t try the restaurant, the choice of food (and prices) found in the room service menu, looked quite reasonable. The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. The price (again, as of November ’09) appeared very reasonable in comparison to other similar hotels. Negative points (generally very minor):- The hotel lacked a bar, gym and pool – facilities that some of the similar priced hotels, had.(Not a major issue, as personally when I am staying in Hong Kong I prefer to be out rather than in.) The views from the rooms (certainly at least up to the 13th floor), were obscured by tall residential tower blocks. Unfortunately during my stay, one of the three lifts was out of service, meaning that it took a while to get down to the lobby in the mornings. Comparisons: I have previously stayed at the Kimberley and City Garden hotels and would overall recommend the Empire hotel over these – particularly if the purpose of the trip is for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SaSa31
Reviews.Content: I have been to HK several times and have always stayed with relatives who live across the road from this hotel and therefore familiarity of the area is one of the main reasons why I chose to stay here. It is not in Causeway Bay however, it is a nice 10-15minute walk through Victoria Park to reach Causeway Bay. Check in was a breeze and straightforward. There was however, a long wait for the lift up to our room on Level 13. This was something that happened each time we needed to go up/down. Upon reaching our floor, I noticed a strong cigarette smell in the hallway and also in our room (I had asked for a non-smoking room). The smell left once we had turned the air con on, however the smokey smell would always be there when we returned to our room in the afternoon. I think our neighbours must have been smoking and the smoke travels through the vents .. I am not sure. But once the air con was on the smell disappeared. The room was small but that was expected. Everything else was sufficient and the magic glass in the bathroom wouldn't be a problem if you wanted some privacy. My only concern is that the carpet seemed a little dirty and could do with a vacuum. I don't think they vacuumed the floor once during our stay. We did not eat at the hotel as on the neighbouring "electric road" there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The Tak Cheong noodle shop, Mak's beef noodles and the ching ching dessert shops are a must try. I also cannot really comment on the customer service from the staff as we did not have much dealings with them. We really only used the hotel to shower + sleep at night. Another thing I noticed was the huge number of tourists/tour groups from the mainland staying at The Empire. I would recommend this hotel to other travellors due to it being such great value. However, I feel that if you are a first time travellor to HK it might be better to choose a hotel in the middle of Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: GOY_P
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel only 3 days 2 nights. I quite surprised to see this hotel at the first time because it's very clean and good for travel business trip. The room is a little small but I sleep alone so it's really fine for me. The bad thing about this hotel is no wifi and you have to pay for internet 40HKD / hour . And another thing as I travel a lot. Very bad experience for me was in the first day I came back to hotel very late and really need to shower but there was no shower cream. I was sooo wet already so I have to called house keeper to fill it up. If you asked me I will go back to this hotel or not. I may be go back or may be not. I think this hotel is good but the service is poor!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: charmomg
Reviews.Content: Although it's called Empire Hotel Causeway Bay, it is actually located in Tin Hau, a 5-10 minute walk from the Tin Hau MTR station. So don't be fooled like us and get off at Causeway Bay station! Tin Hau is a residential area with minimal restaurants & shops, in other words, not much to do. If we went to Hong Kong again, we will definitely choose a better location, where the hustle and bustle is so we can just walk down the street to go shopping, drinks, clubbing, food etc and not have to catch the MTR back to Tin Hau everyday. For a more in depth review with photos, check out my blog post at http://christopherlee.com.au/2009/08/22/empire-hotel-causeway-bay-review/

Reviews.Title: “Great economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtnyc2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Empire for 12 days in total during my trip to Hong Kong. I initially booked only for 5 nights and booked additional 7 nights after my stay. I was able to get it for $ 52 per night including buffet breakfast for two. Great bargain for the price. The hotel is close to MTR. There are many local restaurants at the corner of the hotel. The drawback is the elevator. Since there are no sign on the limit of people in the elevator, one of the two elevators is constantly out of order. I defintely will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: asia0709
Reviews.Content: This place was great for what you pay. The hotel is less then 1 year old. One of the cheaper quality hotels in HK and close to subway station and other shops. The room was kinda compact but the space works and the HD lcd flat panel tv on the wall saves alot of space and looks great. There is a safe built into a cabinet where u set the password, very helpful as it fit my laptop and passports. The washroom has an interesting design with magic glass that can become clear or opaque with a switch. The A/C was very powerful and could make the room a fridge if you wanted. The hotel is at the far end of causeway bay but there is still a 7/11 just down the road as well as a MC D. There is also a grocery store if you cross through an alley next to sanitation station across from hotel. A subway station is just 3 blocks behind hotel.The transit system is great there. Victoria park is also just blocks away. Service was pretty decent, don't really order room service but was fast checkin and out. I recommend this hotel if you want to save money and still have a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but go for other options”
Reviews.Author: rwintour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Causewaya bay from 29th of July to 2nd of Aug, as recommended by my travel agents as the rate is interesting HKD$550 per nite net. Room: Pretty small but still comfortable, clean, very compact design, good tea making facilities, writing desk, safe deposit box and interesting bathroom with rainforest shower. It suits to the rate we get for the quality; but you're big guys, you may feel the room is uncomfortably small. Neighbourhood: the hotel is located at the fringe of causeway bay (CB), so you must walk to the center of the CB about 15 minutes or take MTR at nearest station which is Tin Hau of about 5 minutes walk from the Hotel. The surrounding is dominated by residential apartment towers and local chinese eateries and shops but not for tourists. So dont expect you will find shops and eateries like in causeway, its kind of different atmosphere here. Service : The front desk staff to security are friendly and helpful. The flaws are the housekeeping team performance: they dont clean the room properly : 1. One day they clean the cups; but the glass left dirty 2. They dont fix the bed and the duvet properly as if they dont have standard to fix it 3. The trash bin left full 4. Rarely change the towels 5. On our last day, only one big towel left in our room So overall impression of staying in this hotel: if you re tight on budget, just nice to stay in : if have little more budget (US$ 30 more) go to express holiday inn which located at the Time Square, very close to the heart of causeway bay where you can enjoy so much

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with the Empire.”
Reviews.Author: netmonster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and could have stayed more. The hotel is of 4* class except for the the size of the rooms. But this is Hong Kong? The location is excellent, very close to the MTR, shops, resturants, and parks. There were a few quirks(elevators) but for the price it is excellent.. We had a great breakfast at an European like place on nearby Electric Road and had our laundry done across from the hotel. Both were very reasonable. We thought about staying on Nathen Road and were so glad we didn't after seening it. We liked this area so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value - Location is the best for this price”
Reviews.Author: will678021
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the hotel as I write this. I lived in Hongkong 15 years ago and have been back here frequently for business staying at most hotels that are budget priced. This is not to pan the previous reviewer but you gotta get realistic. This place is undoubtedly the best value, I still can't believe the price. Perhaps it's new and they are doing a special. This is the only review I've ever written here and I'm doing it because I'm compelled to do it by the incredible value I've gotten. First of all the location is incredible. the previous reviewer wanted signs at the MTR? Do you know how much that would cost, this is not the Grand Hyatt here? That was pretty funny when I read it. The place is 3 minutes from the station and the tram is 1 minute away. You simply cannot find a place this close to the MTR at this price. The rooms are new, blankets are comfortable. OK, rooms are not big but what do you expect at this price? The TV is the same size as the one in my house which is 42", I've NEVER seen a TV this big and it has HD channels. The shower is cool with magic glass. It's clean. Service is good for this price range. I'm not sure what the previous reviewer expects, this is a budget hotel with a lot of rooms. The only complaint is that it doesn't have free wireless internet but I was able to get it everywhere and use a different service provider. The elevators didn't all work all the time, most of the time it did. But cmon the hotel is new and there is maintenance. The key thing to look at is if it's quiet and it is. Look this is not the Grand Hyatt or the Marriott. I've stayed at the other top ranked hotel, JJ Hotel and it was noisy and did not have a decent lobby as I had to share it with people going to karaoke and other services in the building. I'm simply surprised when I read reviews on these sites. Without a doubt this is the best value hotel I've ever stayed in and I've stayed in hundreds.

Reviews.Title: “It looks nice but there are many design flaws and service issues that make staying here very frustrating”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior7000
Reviews.Content: The Good: * The interiors look nice (lobby, restaurant, room etc) * Check-in is efficient and someone comes to your room and demonstrates the features eg the bathroom's "magic glass" * Housekeeping cleaned my room while I was at breakfast. I never saw them and was only gone about 30 mins - this is the most efficient housekeeping I've seen! * If you're into the size of your diagonal, this is the largest LCD TV I've seen in a hotel room - 50"? The Bad: * First frustration is that the hotel is not on the map at the nearby Tin Hau MTR and the MTR map has North at the bottom to further confuse things Service: * During most of my stay only 1 of 3 lifts worked * On one day the only working lift behaved erratically and took 2 attempts to reach the ground floor from the top * Even when the lifts appeared to be working their behaviour was quirky and I was on alert in case it didn't respond properly to buttons pressed * There was no letter from management in my room to explain the lift maintenance (most hotels do have such a letter when they're under maintenance) Breakfast: * finishes at an early 10am. This wasn't explained, or written down anywhere. The room service menu implies it lasts til 11.30am * items run out and are not replenished automatically: you have to ask * one day there was no cereal (just a blank space). Upon asking I discovered there was no milk! (Lucky I don't take milk in my coffee) Design: Lifts: * When the lift arrives you can't tell if it's going up or down, there's just a single light. After going the wrong way a couple of times you soon learn to ask the occupants "going up or down?" (is this the 1950s?) * Only the G floor has indicators to show where the lifts currently are while you wait. On guest and restaurant levels you just wait and wait with no idea when the lift will arrive. To amuse yourself you can watch the "out of service" sign scroll over and over. * Inside the lift it's too dark to read the buttons * The important G and 1 (Restaurant) buttons are not separated from guest floor buttons. I saw a number of people get out at the Restaurant when they meant to get out at the Lobby (G). * There's a nice LCD TV to watch the news in the lift - it's mounted high but the picture is distorted unless you stand at the very back of the lift (a bit like the way the picture distorts on an aircraft back of seat TV until you adjust the brightness) Room: * Door closes heavily with a loud bang - it needs some damping. If you're unlucky your neighbours bang the doors all night. * The bathroom is in a glassed off corner of the room with "magic glass" to make it opaque. The problem is if you have a hot shower you get condensation in the whole room: everything is damp for ages afterwards. It could affect electronic devices. * The towel rail is inconveniently placed to give you maximum opportunity to bump your head on the corner of it. The hotel is new (3 mths old) and has potential. The rooms are nicely finished but so many design flaws and service issues make staying here a frustrating experience. I think it promises much more than it delivers - a bit more attention to service and expectation setting and it would be good. I hate to whinge like this on a 3rd party web site but I did try and contact them via their website with my feedback. They never replied.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: booked initially for 2 nites only but upon arrival decided to stay for 6 nites. located a couple of blocks from victoria park, next to electric road which has bakeries, little restaurants, laundry, etc. couple of blocks walk to tin hau mtr station. even though it's not a small hotel by any measure (26 floors), it had the atmosphere of a small boutique hotel - friendly staff, short corridors, etc. the hotel and its rooms have a simple design, not tacky clutter or shining brass. the view from a corner room was very nice, to both the harbour and HK island skyline. a large person might find the room too small and the bed too short. only downside is the internet was not free, but 120hkd / 24h. however if this is summed up with the online rate, it's still pretty good and competitive. i assume once they get their fitness centers etc up and running the rate will hike, but at least in the meantime this place is a real gem. (if you don't need fitness centers etc that is.)

Reviews.Title: “a new hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: alsch1111
Reviews.Content: I second everything the previous reviewer wrote. I would always rather stay at a new or newer hotel. The hotel is almost adjacent to Victoria Park, which is a really relaxing place. The eating extends all the way east to the adjacent area of North Point along both Electric Ave. and Causeway Road. It's a very interesting area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nicque-star
Reviews.Content: Empire Hotel is a well known Hong Kong hotel chain but this hotel is brand new (it was opened less than a month when we stayed there). First of all, its NOT in Causeway Bay but in the next area called Tin Hau. They probably called it Causeway Way because that's a far more popular and marketable location. However, this hotel is not badly located at all. Its just 5 mins walk to the Tin Hau MTR station (which is one stop from Causeway Bay). The biggest bonus about the location is that its located right in the middle of the eating street of Tin Hau with all sorts of local, Asian and foreign restaurants. The hotel room itself is quite a standard Hong Kong hotel room albeit with some nice modernist touches with the usual glass and metal finishes which can be quite cool. The rooms are however on the small side and the writing desk is absolutely tiny (it can barely fit a book and a notebook computer). The other downside to the hotel is that it only has local TV channels and not a single foreign pay TV channel. I hope this is because its new and they haven't added the new Pay TV channels. All in all, this is a very comfortable (albeit on the small side) hotel in a very convenient location and represents very good value. I would thoroughly recommend it for a comfortable stay in HK. Watch out for the "Magic Button" situated in both the bathroom and the side of the bed. Its so cool and absolutely hilarious!!
